```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
```

```{r libraries, include = FALSE}
## Import libraries
library(tidyverse)
library(tidyr)
library(readr)
library(skimr)
library(dplyr)
library(usdarnass)
library(ggplot2)

```
# import the n2o data
# source:
```{r import_n2o}

n2o <- read_table("N2O_LawDome_MBL.txt", skip = 1, col_names = TRUE)
cols(
  year = col_double(),
  "N2O (ppb)" = col_double()
)
```
# import the co2 data
# source: xxx
```{r import_co2}
co2 <- read_table("CO2_LawDome_MLO.txt", skip = 1, col_names = TRUE)
cols(
  year = col_date(),
  "CO2 (ppm)" = col_double()
)
```

```{r n2o_plot}
ggplot(data = co2, aes(x = year, y = "N2O (ppb)")) + 
  #geom_line() +
  geom_point()
```

```{r co2_plot}
ggplot(data = co2, aes(x = year, y = "CO2 (ppm)")) + 
  geom_point()
```

}
## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
plot(pressure)
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.
